name: Infrared Heated Thermal Hot Round Brush
about: What it is: A heated round brush that harnesses infrared technology to create instant volume and a healthy bounce, for sleek and shiny hairstyles...Hair Type: Straight, Wavy, and Curly..Hair Texture: Fine, Medium, and Thick..Hair Concerns:- Frizz.- Shine.- Volumizing..Key Benefits: - Creates soft bouncy waves.- Adds volume.- Increases shine..What Else You Need to Know: Hello, u201990s supermodel hair! The Infrared Bounce Brush gives the most volumized, bouncy, catwalk-worthy hair. Infrared gently heats the hair from within, causing less damage than traditional forms of heat. Negative ions lock in moisture and aloe-infused bristles reduce frizz and add shine...Clinical Results: Clinically proven to:.- Cause no heat damage.- Give all day volume.- Increase volume by 67% after 1 use.- Immediately increase shine by 47% after 1 use.- Immediately reduce frizz by 35% after 1 use.*Based on instrumental testing on hair tresses..
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Always start with dry hair..-Wrap your hair around the brush as you slowly style for the softest, glossiest, u201990s-inspired volume..-More about u201900s voluminous oomph? Pop it under your hair at the roots, then slowly glide it down to your ends..-Use on air-dried hair, second-day hair, or for daily touch ups....Pro Tip for Extra Wave:.-Wrap your dry hair around the brush..-Hold in place for 10 to 15 seconds..-Slowly twist the brush out..-Enjoy maximum swishy bounciness.

And let's not forget about the design u2013 sleek, ergonomic, and oh-so-stylish. It's lightweight and comfortable to hold, making styling a breeze. Plus, the swivel cord ensures tangle-free maneuverability, which is a huge plus in my book.  Overall, I can't recommend the Infrared Heated Thermal Hot Round Brush enough. It's efficient, effective, and versatile, making it a must-have for anyone looking to elevate their hair styling game. Trust me, once you try it, you'll wonder how you ever lived without it.

reviews.review_title: Read for a NON incentivized review
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is a real, non-incentivized review from a purchase that I made with my own money! I have been looking for a thermal brush that would replace my desire for a Dyson air wrap, because what I really need is something to style my hair quickly even if I donu2019t take the time to blow dry or blow out my hair. I did my research, and knew that a thermal brush would be right for me if I just woke up with my natural wavy hair. I bought something similar from Amazon for about 50 bucks and it had a plastic smell and got very hot. My hair handles heat pretty well so I donu2019t actually have to use that high of a setting, so when I heard about a brush with customizable settings, I wanted to try it. However I knew it was a stretch in price. I bought it directly from Bondi boost because it was sold out here in Sephora. Total time it took for me to style my hair on 350 was 15 minutes. And the results were magical! The Amazon brush worked just like a normal hair curler that left my hair flatter than I wanted, so itu2019s just like a curling iron and not a blow out. This brush makes my hair look like I just left the salon. I donu2019t struggle with volume either but the Amazon brush made my hair flatter than normal and this brush gave me so much bounce in the end result! I was super skeptical but I think this is a really good find. Wanted to share my experience with other people who might be skeptical as well with the incentivized

reviews.review_title: It didn't work for my hair
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I was excited to try this brush as a way to reduce damaging heat styling.  Unfortunately, it didn't really do much for me.  I have straight hair that's a bit frizzy after blowdrying with a round brush.  I was hoping for a 90s blowout look with this.  I pumped the BondiBoost brush up to 375.  It curled my ends under, but did nothing for the frizz after multiple passes.  One pass of my flat iron at 345 and my hair is sleek.  I live in the south, so I imagine this would underperform come the heat and humidity of summer.  My hair is also heavily highlighted and has some damage from that.  Maybe it works better on thicker, virgin hair.
